content:
I don't have access to current data, and my training data only goes up to october 2021. however, i can say that, like any urban development, rennes' urban design may have some negative impacts such as displacement or gentrification of certain communities. for example, the revitalization of some neighborhoods may result in the displacement of long-time residents who can no longer afford to live in the area due to rising property values and rents.

moreover, while the pedestrian-friendly streets and bike path network have made transportation more accessible, some residents may find the public transportation system to be inadequate, resulting in longer commute times and reduced access to employment opportunities.

however, it's essential to keep in mind that rennes' urban design is an ongoing process, and the city authorities are continually working to address and mitigate any negative impacts that may arise. for instance, the local government can offer affordable housing initiatives or transport subsidies to low-income residents to avoid displacement, while the local transportation authority can improve the public transport system to ensure better connectivity to all parts of the city.
